title: How NASA's Parker Solar Probe got closer to the Sun than ever before on December 24? - India TV News
summary:
How NASA's Parker Solar Probe got closer to the Sun than ever before on December 24

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: India TV News

NASA's Parker Solar Probe is set to achieve a monumental milestone with its closest approach to the Sun on December 24, 2024, reaching just 6.1 million kilometers from the Sun's surface.

  • This flyby marks the 22nd close encounter of the mission.
  • The probe will reach speeds of 692,000 kilometers per hour and study the Sun's corona.
  • NASA plans to provide updates post-flyby through its channels.
  • The mission will conclude in 2025 with a total of 24 solar encounters.
"The Parker Solar Probe will fly through the Sun's outer atmosphere, known as the corona, at an incredible speed of 692,000 kilometres per hour."

This landmark flyby paves the way for future data collection during a period of intense solar activity expected throughout 2025.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Breaks Records with Closest Approach to the Sun

title: 7 Majestic Images Of Black Holes Captured By NASA - Times Now
summary:
7 Majestic Images Of Black Holes Captured By NASA

Publication Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Times Now

This article presents stunning imagery of black holes captured by NASA, highlighting groundbreaking discoveries in the field of astrophysics.

  • A Dust-Bound Supermassive Black Hole surrounded by swirling debris.
  • A black hole releasing two bubbles of hot gas observed 900 million light-years away.
  • Illustration depicting the potential origins of supermassive black hole seeds.
  • Hubble imagery capturing ghostly green filaments within the Teacup galaxy.
  • An artistic portrayal of a binary black hole in the closest quasar to Earth.
  • Quasar energy impacting galaxy structures through high-speed material expulsion.
  • NGC 5548 exhibits unique behavior obstructing X-ray emissions from a supermassive black hole.
“These stunning images shed light on the complex behaviors of black holes and their interactions with surrounding galaxies.”

These images not only enhance our understanding of black holes but also inspire curiosity and encourage further exploration in space science.
newTitle: 7 Majestic Images Of Black Holes Captured By NASA

title: Marathi Actress Urmila Kothare's Vehicle Runs Over Labourers In Mumbai, 1 Killed - News18
summary:
Urmila Kothare's Vehicle Runs Over Labourers In Mumbai, 1 Killed

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: News18

In a tragic accident, Marathi actress Urmila Kothare’s car ran over two labourers in Mumbai’s Kandivali area, killing one and seriously injuring the other. The actor and her driver were also injured in the accident.

  • The accident occurred after Kothare was returning home from a shoot.
  • The car was reportedly driven at high speed before losing control.
  • A case has been registered against the car driver, and an investigation is ongoing.
  • Kothare's vehicle was damaged in the accident, but she sustained only minor injuries.

“Kothare’s car hit two labourers who were engaged in Metro rail work under the Poisar Metro station in Kandivali east shortly after midnight. While labourer died, another was seriously injured,” a police official stated.

This accident underscores the importance of road safety and the potential consequences of high-speed driving.
newTitle: Urmila Kothare's Car Accident in Mumbai Claims Life of Labourer

title: Cochin Shipyard bags Adani Ports tug boat order, deal value estimated at ₹450 crore | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Cochin Shipyard Wins ₹450 Crore Tug Boat Order from Adani Ports

Publication Date: December 27, Source: Live Mint

Adani Ports has ordered eight tug boats from Cochin Shipyard Ltd, valued at ₹450 crore, to enhance its maritime infrastructure.

The order consists of eight 70 T Bollard Pull ASD Tugs, expected to be delivered from December 2026 to August 2028.

  • Adani Ports and SEZ orders eight tug boats from Cochin Shipyard.
  • The deal is valued at ₹450 crore, falling under the “Significant” category of ₹200 to ₹500 crore.
  • Tug deliveries are set to begin in December 2026.
  • This order will expand Adani's tug boat fleet to 152.
  • Adani aims to strengthen local manufacturing with this collaboration.
“This collaboration signifies our commitment to enhancing maritime infrastructure in India and demonstrates our confidence in our nation's PSUs.” - Ashwani Gupta, CEO of Adani Ports

This significant order highlights the growing cooperation between private companies and public sector units in India’s maritime sector.
newTitle: Cochin Shipyard Wins ₹450 Crore Tug Boat Order from Adani Ports

title: ‘Totally insulted by the present government’: Rahul Gandhi on Manmohan Singh’s cremation - The Times of India
summary:

Publication Date: January 27, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Rahul Gandhi expressed strong feelings regarding the treatment of Manmohan Singh’s legacy by the current government during the funeral of the former Prime Minister, which took place at Delhi's Nigambodh Ghat.

  • Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92 on January 26, 2023.
  • The cremation was attended by several dignitaries, including President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Rahul Gandhi stated that the government's actions towards Manmohan Singh were insulting, reflecting on his contribution to the nation.
  • Singh was given full state honors, including a 21-gun salute.
  • The event highlighted the divide between current political sentiments and the respect for past leadership.
“The government has totally insulted his legacy.” - Rahul Gandhi

This event highlights the ongoing political discourse in India regarding respect for former leaders and the legacy they leave behind.

summary:
Israel Deploys US THAAD System for First Time

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of Israel

This article discusses Israel's recent deployment of the US THAAD (Terminal High Altitude Area Defense) system, marking its first operational use. The THAAD system is designed to protect against short, medium, and intermediate-range ballistic missiles.

  • The THAAD system was deployed amidst growing regional tensions.
  • This marks a significant step in Israel's missile defense strategy.
  • The system's effectiveness in real-world scenarios is yet to be fully evaluated.
“The deployment of THAAD is a crucial enhancement to our defense capabilities,” said an Israeli military official.

In conclusion, the THAAD deployment symbolizes a deepening military cooperation between the US and Israel and reflects the ongoing threats in the region.

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Nitish Kumar Reddy made headlines by scoring his first Test century against Australia, leading his team from a precarious position to a celebrated win.

  • Reddy scored a pivotal century against a challenging bowling attack including Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc.
  • MSK Prasad, former chief selector, expressed deep emotional pride regarding Reddy's performance.
  • Reddy’s father felt overwhelmed, witnessing his son's remarkable achievement from the stands.
  • Reddy has consistently performed well in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, showcasing his potential as a rising star.

title: Carlsen Quits Rapid & Blitz Championships; Murzin, Duda, Arjun, Grischuk Lead Open - Chess.com
summary:
Carlsen Quits Rapid & Blitz Championships; Murzin, Duda, Arjun, Grischuk Lead Open

Publication Date: December 28, 2024
Source: Chess.com

Magnus Carlsen has announced he will not continue in the 2024 FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championships due to a disagreement with FIDE regarding dress code regulations. This decision ensures new champions will be crowned this year.

  • Carlsen finishes the Rapid Championship with a score of 5/8.
  • Leading the Open championship are GM Volodar Murzin, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Arjun Erigaisi, and Alexander Grischuk with a score of 7/9.
  • Carlsen received a $200 fine for violating the dress code.
  • Chief Arbiter confirmed Carlsen wasn't forced out but he chose to leave.
  • The women's championship sees Ju Wenjun, Harika Dronavalli, and Koneru Humpy at the top with a score of 6.5/8.

My patience with them was not very big to begin with. It's fine, then I'm out, then f**k you.

—Magnus Carlsen

FIDE reiterated the importance of adhering to dress codes for maintaining professionalism and an equal playing field.
newTitle: Carlsen Withdraws from Rapid & Blitz Championships; New Leaders Emerge

title: Vodafone Group clears about Rs 11,650 cr dues raised against VIL shares - Business Standard
summary:
Vodafone Clears Rs 11,650 Crore Dues from VIL Shares

Publication Date: Dec 28 2024 | Source: Press Trust of India

UK-based Vodafone Group has successfully cleared dues of approximately Rs 11,650 crore against shares of Vodafone Idea Limited (VIL), reaffirming its financial commitments.

  • Vodafone had pledged nearly its entire stake in VIL to secure the debt.
  • The dues were cleared as of December 27, 2024, through HSBC Corporate Trustee Company (UK).
  • The shares in question are valued at around Rs 11,649 crore based on the closing price of Rs 7.41 per share.
  • Vodafone holds a 22.56% stake in VIL, while Aditya Birla Group and the government hold 14.76% and 23.15% shares respectively.
"Consequently, the indirect encumbrance on 15,720,826,860 equity shares... has been released."

This clearance demonstrates Vodafone's ongoing strategy to stabilize its finances and potentially strengthen its position in the Indian telecom market.
newTitle: Vodafone Clears Rs 11,650 Crore Dues from VIL Shares

title: Study shows shocking link between hair products and cancer; here are the details - The Week
summary:
Study shows shocking link between hair products and cancer; here are the details

Publication Date: 2024 Source: European Journal of Obstetrics and Gynaecology and Reproductive Biology

This article discusses a recent study highlighting the risks associated with chemicals in hair dyes and chemical straighteners, including potential links to breast and ovarian cancer.

  • A study published in 2024 indicates that hair products often contain harmful chemicals.
  • These chemicals can disrupt hormones and are associated with cancer risks.
  • Common harmful chemicals include aromatic amines, parabens, and formaldehyde.
  • Women are at greater risk due to higher usage of these products.
  • Recommendations include minimizing the use of such products and opting for safer alternatives.
“Hair products often contain chemicals…giving rise to concerns about the possible adverse effects such as hormonal disturbances and carcinogenicity.”

In conclusion, increased awareness and caution are essential for consumers regarding the use of chemical-laden hair products.
newTitle: Study Links Hair Products to Cancer Risk

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Madras High Court says IPS officers team, comprising women only, to probe Chennai sexual assault case - The Hindu
summary:
Madras High Court Forms Women-Only Team to Investigate Anna University Sexual Assault

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Madras High Court has constituted an all-woman team of IPS officers to investigate the sexual assault of a student at Anna University, along with the leak of the FIR related to the case.

  • The court ordered a Special Investigation Team (SIT) including IPS officers Bhukya Sneha Priya, Ayman Jamal, and S. Brinda.
  • The Tamil Nadu government consented to the formation of the SIT.
  • The court mandated the state to pay ₹25 lakh in compensation to the survivor.
  • It was stated that the university should not collect any fees from the survivor and must provide necessary counseling and assistance.
  • The court directed the government to consider action against the Greater Chennai Commissioner of Police for revealing investigation details prematurely.
  • The judges criticized the wording of the FIR which led to victim-shaming.
  • A technical glitch was cited as the reason for the leak of the FIR.
“When the Constitution does not discriminate between men and women, society cannot dictate how women should conduct themselves.”

The Madras High Court's decision to form an all-women team signifies a step towards ensuring sensitive handling of sexual assault cases in India.
newTitle: Madras High Court Forms Women-Only Team to Investigate Anna University Sexual Assault

title: Madras High Court orders SIT probe into Anna University sexual assault, directs ₹25 lakh compensation for victim - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Madras High Court Orders SIT Probe into Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Published on: 28 Dec 2024, 7:47 am, Source: Unknown

The Madras High Court has directed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the sexual assault of a 19-year-old student from Anna University, amidst concerns of police negligence in handling the case.

  • The Court ordered an interim compensation of ₹25 lakh to the victim.
  • Police are instructed to provide protection to the victim and her family.
  • A SIT will be formed with three Indian Police Service officers due to the ongoing investigation's shortcomings.
  • The High Court condemned the victim-blaming language in the First Information Report (FIR).
  • The Court highlighted the need to protect women's rights and dignity.
"The deplorable language of the FIR paves the way for victim blaming. It is shocking."

In conclusion, the Court emphasized that the society must work towards protecting women and ensuring that they do not face judgment based on their gender.
newTitle: Madras High Court Orders SIT Probe into Anna University Sexual Assault Case

title: Pakistan vs Afghanistan: Taliban attack Pakistan, capture two posts of Pakistan Army, kill 19 soldiers, 'war' - India.com
How space junk endangers Earth's orbit: All you need to know about 'Kessler Syndrome' - The Times of India
summary:
How Space Junk Endangers Earth's Orbit: Understanding Kessler Syndrome

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CNN

Space debris is increasingly problematic as Earth's orbit becomes congested, potentially leading to Kessler Syndrome, a catastrophic cascade of collisions in space.

  • Kessler Syndrome refers to the chain reaction of collisions in space that creates more debris.
  • Since the 1950s, over 50,000 tons of material have been launched into orbit, with approximately 13,000 tons remaining.
  • Active satellite constellations like SpaceX's Starlink are exacerbating the situation.
  • High-speed orbital debris poses a significant threat, causing the ISS to perform avoidance maneuvers frequently.
  • Efforts to mitigate space debris include cleanup technologies and international regulations.
"Proactive measures are essential to prevent irreversible damage to our orbital environment." - Dr. Nilton Renno, University of Michigan

Experts stress the importance of addressing space debris before it leads to catastrophic consequences in Earth's orbit.
newTitle: How Space Junk Endangers Earth's Orbit: Understanding Kessler Syndrome

title: ‘Magnus Carlsen was given enough time to change his jeans. We didn't ban him; could've played': FIDE CEO - Hindustan Times
summary:
FIDE CEO Explains Magnus Carlsen's Disqualification Over Dress Code

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

FIDE CEO Emil Sutovski stated that Magnus Carlsen was given ample opportunity to change into formal attire before being disqualified from the World Rapid and Blitz Championship for wearing jeans, which violated tournament regulations.

  • Sutovski clarified that Carlsen was not banned but failed to comply with the dress code.
  • He noted that rules must apply to all participants and highlighted previous penalties for similar violations.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE's dress code policies and decided to withdraw from the Blitz section of the tournament.
“I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them.” - Magnus Carlsen

The situation underscores the ongoing tension between tournament regulations and player preferences regarding dress codes in chess.
newTitle: FIDE CEO Explains Magnus Carlsen's Disqualification Over Dress Code
